parameters.name: ModuleHandle
parameters.description: Module handle of the application instance that contains the image resource

parameters.name: BitmapUp
parameters.description: Resource ID of the not-clicked state image resource

parameters.name: BitmapDown
parameters.description: Resource ID of the clicked state image resource

parameters.name: BitmapDisabled
parameters.description: Resource ID of the disabled state image resource

title: IPropertyManagerPageBitmapButton.SetBitmapsx64
description: Sets the images for this button in 64-bit applications.
signature:
System.Boolean SetBitmapsx64( 
   System.Int64
ModuleHandle
,
   System.Int32
BitmapUp
,
   System.Int32
BitmapDown
,
   System.Int32
BitmapDisabled
)

parameters.name: ModuleHandle
parameters.description: Module handle of the application instance that contains the image resource

parameters.name: BitmapUp
parameters.description: Resource ID of the not-clicked state image resource

parameters.name: BitmapDown
parameters.description: Resource ID of the clicked state image resource

parameters.name: BitmapDisabled
parameters.description: Resource ID of the disabled state image resource

returns: True if successful, false if not
remarks:
This method is only available through early binding and with 64-bit versions of the SOLIDWORKS Design software.
The ModuleHandle argument for this method is the handle to the instance ( HINSTANCE ) of the user DLL, and the resource IDs for the not-clicked, clicked, and disabled states are the image resource integers. The SOLIDWORKS Design application loads the images from the user DLL and uses them on this bitmap button control.
You must call this method after calling either of the following methods to create the bitmap button control:
IPropertyManagerPage2::AddControl
or
IPropertyManagerPage2::IAddControl
IPropertyManagerPageGroup::AddControl
or
IPropertyManagerPageGroup::IAddControl
